resources.string: Nie udało się wykryć startu transmisji, spróbuj ponownie..
nie może być odczytany - prawdopodobnie brak uprawnień odczytu.
, perhaps storage mounted readonly or lack of permission ? Transmission will likely fail. You might also want to restart system.

Use this app to receive/send small files (1MB limit per file in the free version of this app) as the stream of QR frames through the phone\'s camera.\n
You can generate file QR stream from this app or also the desktop PC - see Windows and Linux programs for uploading files.\n
1. Keep the camera straight - avoid tilting.
2. Make sure camera autofocus correctly - if not, try waving hand quickly in front of it, or tap the screen to request autofocus.

3. Keep the highlight green if you can. The greener the highlight gets, the less error is generated, and higher the chance that the transmission will succeed. \nObserve also the noise bar during transmission - avoid getting it fully red when the chunk changes.\n
4. Try to capture significant part of the start sequence as well with the camera focused - without it the transmission will not even start.

This sets the Frames Per Seconds (FPS) of the generated QR stream by the file uploader. 


Larger value : 

 + Increase transmission speed

 but, at the same time:

 - Increase the chance for the failure of transmission if the receiver cannot pick up frames fast enough

This sets the amount of redundancy that the QR frame producer will generate.


Larger value :


+ Transmission more resilient for errors

 but, at the same time : 

 - Transmission is slower


If the noise bar during transmission reception is often green for you when the chunk number increases/transmission ends, then you can afford to lower this maximum error value to increase transfer speed.

This sets the size of each produced QR frame. 

 Larger value :


+ Faster transmission

 but, at the same time : 

 - Increase the chance for failure in the receiver and requires better camera positioning/focus.


When this size go above about 850B, there are often serious problems of receiving anything with reasonable speed.

This sets the time in seconds, that the initializing startup sequence is displayed in the frame producer.

 It is neccssary to capture at least some fragment of this startup sequence to allow proper initialization on the receiver end.


Larger value :


+ Gives more time to manually align camera, catch camera focus, etc.

 but, at the same time : 

 - Makes the transmission unnecessary few seconds longer, if the start sequence can already be quickly captured.

The privacy policy for this app can be found under this link, but it is also presented here below: 

 	This application does not collect any of your data. It only uses the camera to capture the stream of QR frames in order to recreate as a file. So it needs camera system permission and both the permission to read and write to the file storage - only to do the file transmission. No other usage of files occurs other than to do the transmission.


This application also requires permission for system setting write. It only needs to use those system settings permission in order to brighten up the screen at the time when file is being transmitted as a stream of QR frames and go back to original brightness after it has finished - that lets the receiver camera pick up the image more easily. No other system settings other than this brightness manipulation are changed.


This app uses the Google's advertisement services to display the advertisement banner in its free version. It might collect some of your data - see the Google privacy policy to know more. In order to use this ad service, this app in its free version requires permission for the network - it does not transmits other data through the network other than what is needed for the Google's advertisement service. In the non-free version, the network permissions are not necessary, since there is no ads then.



This application contains links to other sites. If you click on a third-party link, you will be directed to that site. Note that these external sites are not operated by me. Therefore, I strongly advise you to review the Privacy Policy of these websites. I have no control over and assume no responsibility for the content, privacy policies, or practices of any third-party sites or services. 

 This application can also request some action from other applications, like opening a file by some external application. No information other than query terms are passed to the intent then (like in the case of opening a file or link, only the link or file path and mimetype is passed to the external application - nothing else) - so the privacy policy of this external apps should be looked up then.

Optical file transfer is application that uses stream of QR frames to transfer files between phones and from desktop PC to phone (see the Windows and Linux complementary applications for file upload from desktop PC).

Advantages 
 • Minimal preparations required once parameters are tweaked - just point the camera on the QR stream and wait for the file to transfer.
 • Fully off-line - no network setup at all.
 • It is wireless and does emit little RF noise to the environment, compared to WiFi or BT - so you can do wireless file transmission while the phones are in the airplane mode and you do not have infrared port in any of them.


 Disadvantages 
 • It is very slow, so only reasonable for small files.
 • Does not have any guarantee to finish - requires initial tweaking of transmission settings on the producer side to get optimal transmission speed while keeping errors/noise below the threshold.
 • Affected by noise such as sun reflexes, low brightness on producer side or inability for the camera to focus for prolonged time.

At the moment, on the phone where the QR stream is produced, the screen is brighten up automatically - that requires write system settings permission.
 
 This is the free version - it can capture files of max 1MB in size. See the pro version in the play store, which has this limitation removed.
Following third-party libraries are being used, with their respective licences :\n
\u2022 Android File Chooser - under the Apache 2.0 licence.\n
\u2022 Horizontal Number Picker - under the Apache 2.0 licence.\n
\u2022 SHA256 Hashing Library - on zlib licence.\n
\u2022 KA9Q library - on LGPL licence. See the LGPL compliance note below.\n
\u2022 Libqrencode library - on LGPL licence. See the LGPL compliance note below.\n

Both the libqrencode and ka9q library are under the LGPL licence - so in this application they are used as a separate native shared libraries. 

 The ka9q is simply compiled with the Google's NDK toolchain for arm and armv7a. To get such toolchain, simply download the NDK r14b (the version used for all the native code in this app) and generate standalone toolchain from it - see the instructions for the toolchain on this page.
 With such toolchain, generate the libfec.so yourself by grabbing the KA9Q code (I have made no modifications to that code) and cross-compiling it for architecture of your choice with the gcc/g++ provided in the toolchain.

Regarding the Libqrencode, it is only being used for the wrapper library named libqrencoder_wrapper.so - the code for the wrapper + sample Makefile to use when cross-compiling it is provided in the package that contains the uploader program for the desktop linux - see the directory \'lgpl_libqrencode_wrapper\'. Just like for the desktop version, the Libqrencode code needs to be pulled and provided in directory named as LIBQRENCODER_LIBFOLDERNAME in the makefile (+CROSS for the toolchain prefix).\n

For Windows supplementary uploader program all the LGPL code, sligthly modifed then, is provided as a single dll named encoder_util_lib.dll - and the full Visual Studio 2017 solution + code, to rebuild that library is provided on the windows download page as well under the Third party licences section.\n
This software is provided \'as-is\', without any express or implied warranty.

Unfortunately, the free version of this app does not manages transfer of files of over 1MB in size :-( \n\n See the OpticalFileTransfer pro on the store, where the theoretical limit for a single file is 2GB.
